About Us - Microlap Microlap About Us Products Ferrules Sleeves Custom Components Orifices/Nozzles Windows/Lenses Jewel Bearings Pins/Rods Balls Blades Services Materials Contact Request a Quote Request a Quote Home About Us About Us Custom and specialty manufacturing Microlap is a leading U.S. manufacturer of high-precision industrial components made from synthetic ruby, sapphire, ceramic, carbide and other hard materials. We offer standard products or we can custom-manufacture to your exact specifications. Quality control Strict quality controls are in effect during every phase of design and production. Using microscopes and highly precise measuring instruments, our quality assurance specialists ensure the ultimate in product consistency. Serious about precision for nearly 70 years Microlap was established by the federal government as the Turtle Mountain Ordnance Plant, with production of jewel bearings beginning in 1952. The name was changed in 1973 to the William Langer Jewel Bearing Plant. In 1996, the plant was privatized and renamed Microlap Technologies, Inc. Materials - Microlap Microlap About Us Products Ferrules Sleeves Custom Components Orifices/Nozzles Windows/Lenses Jewel Bearings Pins/Rods Balls Blades Services Materials Contact Request a Quote Request a Quote Home Materials Materials Microlap is a leading US manufacturer of extremely high precision industrial components made from synthetic ruby, synthetic sapphire, ceramic, carbide and other hard materials. Corundum Corundum is the second-hardest natural mineral yet discovered. Red corundum is known as ruby, and all other colors of corundum are known as sapphire. Sapphire and ruby are durable materials with excellent optical characteristics. The durability and hardness of corundum make it resistant to abrasion and damage. Corundum’s unique characteristics make it ideal for a wide range of applications across a variety of industries. Microlap’s unique mechanical manufacturing processes ensures optimum material integrity, while reducing fatigue and stress. Typical uses for Synthetic Ruby and Sapphire Corundum: Ball check valves for precision metering pumps and dispensersJewel BearingsWindows for high temperature or corrosive environmentPen tipsOrifice for air, gas and liquid meteringPistonsWater-jet cutting orifices and nozzlesWire guideProbes for measuring instrumentsBearingsProbes for measuring instrumentsStylus tipsMagnetic tapes cleaning bladesAir bearingsNozzle for printing headsFiber-optic lensesCapillaries and collimatorsChemical and medical valvesFiber-optic connectorsGage contact pointsOptical fiber slicing tipsMedical implant devicesAperture for particles countingGyroscopesRestrictorsAircraft instrumentation Unique Characteristics of Synthetic Ruby and Sapphire Corundum: Single crystalHigh thermal conductivityZero porosityHeat resistantLow friction coefficientChemical inertnessHigh polish attainableLong lifeExtreme hardnessLow specific gravityWear resistantHigh refraction indexNon-magneticShock resistantHigh dielectric strengthCorrosion resistant If you need a precision component that is extremely durable, resistant to corrosion, chemically inert, with zero porosity, Microlap can custom manufacture an economical solution to meet your exact specifications. Jewel Bearings - Microlap Microlap About Us Products Ferrules Sleeves Custom Components Orifices/Nozzles Windows/Lenses Jewel Bearings Pins/Rods Balls Blades Services Materials Contact Request a Quote Request a Quote Home Products Jewel Bearings Jewel Bearings Jewel bearings are used in a variety of applications where durability, wear-resistance, low friction and/or extreme environment conditions are performance factors. Tight tolerances and highly polished finishes are among the greatest attributes of jewel bearings. Typical applications for jewel bearings include precision instrumentation devices; such as measuring instruments, dial indicators, watches, altimeters, gyros, gauges, compasses, fluid or gas flow devices, gimbals, meters, and many other bearing applications. Custom dimensions and tolerances available upon request. Privacy Policy - Microlap Microlap About Us Products Ferrules Sleeves Custom Components Orifices/Nozzles Windows/Lenses Jewel Bearings Pins/Rods Balls Blades Services Materials Contact Request a Quote Request a Quote Home Privacy Policy Privacy Policy Microlap is aware that the security of your private information from the use of our website is an important concern. We take the protection of your personal data very seriously and demonstrate a strong commitment to online privacy. In acknowledgment of that commitment, we have adopted a comprehensive policy to safeguard the privacy of all visitors to the Microlap website. Collection of Data We store data on our servers for various security reasons. This data may include the name of your Internet service provider, click sources, the websites that you visit from our site and your Internet Protocol (IP) address. This information can be used to help diagnose problems with our server, to administer our website, to help identify you and to gather broad demographic information. The data we collect will only be used for the purpose of supplying you with the requested products or services, company marketing purposes or for other reasons for which you have given your consent, except where otherwise provided by law. Security Microlap uses technical and organizational security precautions to protect your data from manipulation, loss, destruction or access by unauthorized persons. Children We do not collect, process or use on our website, any information relating to an individual whom we know to be under 13 years old, without the prior, verifiable consent of his or her legal representative. We do not give children the ability to post or distribute personal information without prior consent. We do not entice children with games or contests that would encourage them to disclose personal information. Disclaimer This site contains links to other sites. Microlap is not responsible for the content or privacy practices of these sites. Contact Us Please contact us if you have any questions or concerns about our privacy policy.
